name: cmr
text: The boffin will only speak to the sort of user who can find him without assistance.

name: dougthehead
text: The boffin is there to cater to Shrovis-Bishopthorpe's surprisingly widespread Linux following.

name: mattfish
text: Mr. Teal is vulnerable to owls and quick dogs, which is the cutest thing ever, next to the boffin's mattress decor

name: doc_rostov
text:
The quick brown fox jumped over the lazy dog.

This is because the dog was lost in Horace.

name: neonaoneo
text: I've never understood the whole 'quick brown fox' thing, as it doesn't contain the letter 'S'.

name: zaratustra
text: That's because it's 'jumps', not 'jumped'.

name: vorrishnikov
text: it's supposed to be "jumps"

name: farqussus
text: jumps is what it is meant to be

name: biff
text:
I heard it as:

The quick brown fox jumped over the lazy dog's back.

name: dangelder
text: Two b's, two a's, two c's, two k's, so it's no cleverer than the dictionary.

name: biff
text:
Hey, I grew up in Oklahoma.

At least it was clever at all.

name: unquotable
text: no more clever?

name: opprobrium
text: It's like how much more clever could this be? And the answer is none, none more clever.

name: baryonyx
text: In conclusion, gentlemen, is has attained Maximum Cleverity.

name: smilebuddha
text: MAXIMUM CLEVERITY! What news from the...erm... West ?

name: mystkmanat
text:
Come on. This deserves way more chubbies. At least up to eleven.

(Yes, I know. Terrible joke.)

name: mjfitzge
text: that sentence is the beast with two backs.

name: drskradley
text:
Ah, "The Beast with Two Backs".

A more un-sexy sex euphemism you will not find.

As was said somewhere else on the net, it sounds like the sort of creature that a hobbit would encounter while going into a cave, that you have to answer a riddle in order to pass.

name: achilleselbow
text: I don't understand what's so strange about this. That is exactly what sex is like.

name: drskradley
text: A chubby for pointing out my indeliberate double-entendre.

name: norrin
text: I beleive that is actually the fabled triple -entendre

name: usversusthem
text: It's slow release, see, cause it takes a comment or two for its existence to become apparent.

name: nickgranger
text: A young woman walks into a bar and asks the bartender for a double entendre, so he gave it to her.

name: tekende
text: Oh my god I wish I could chubby this

name: tekende
text:
Okay, first off, let me admit I do not at all understand this particular thread of comments, as I have no clue what this whole "quick brown fox" thing is all about, or what it is supposed to mean, or why it has been brought up here.

But I was most perplexed by:

Quote:
that sentence is the beast with two backs.


until this morning as I was driving to work and for no reason at all it finally clicked in my head, and I was like "OH!" and then I chuckled.

name: pogo
text: The fox and dog thing is a typing test, uses all 26 letters of the alphabet.

name: will_grizzly
text: it's called a pangram, fools.

name: irondave
text: Are you Sheldon J. Plankton? Because that sounds just like him.

name: jbushnell
text: Like "The five jumping wizards box quickly," which is even shorter.  Or: "Jackdaws love my big Sphinx of quartz," which brings us back to the sex euphemism thing.

name: drskradley
text: Speed-pugilism with leaping masters of the arcane is much more fucking interesting [/i][/b] than one animal jumping over another one who's too stupid to see it.

name: drskradley
text:
Dang-blasted.

much more fucking interesting

name: chachibenji
text: I think that a giant Sphinx made of quartz is pretty rad stuff too, however that just may be my inner Egypto-geologist trying to get some fresh air.

name: jbushnell
text: Sounds like a Lovecraft story in which the protagonist suffocates

name: nigelchaos
text: did you forget to poke holes so he can breathe?

name: johnnyrocker
text: Man that is a sweet mental image.

name: tekende
text: Ohhhhh. Okay. Thanks.

name: streever
text: google..... :)

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
so...it requires you to double-back then, eh?

..this is not a good joke.

name: audhumla
text:
Perfect pangrams are quite ridiculous, though. The only one I've seen that approaches a sensible sentence is: "New job: fix Mr. Gluck's hazy TV, PDQ!". Without abbreviations and names, you're stuck with: Cwm fjord bank glyphs vext quiz.

Of the non-perfect ones, "pack my box with five dozen liquor jugs" is sublime.

name: foea
text: Mr. Jock, TV Quiz PHD, bags few lynx.

name: gormster
text: Yes, I'm going to have to say that proves the point.

name: ishuta
text: The quick brown fox jumped over the lazy dogs.

name: morelaak
text: what amazes me about Mr. Teal is the degree of Artificial Intelligence Shrovis-Bishopthorpe has discovered.

name: gormster
text: Haley Joel Osmont is inside.

name: ntopp
text: Standard "give me back those two hours of my life!" response.

name: meddle
text: I am also vulnerable to owls and quick dogs, but for entirely different reasons.

name: loneal
text: I am also vulnerable to quick dogs, on account of I'm small and weak. That alreadyinuse girl is vulnerable to quick dogs unless she has her pepper spray out.

name: farqussus
text: I think you are talking about quick doggs, or dawgs.

name: baryonyx
text: I think we're assuming that this vulnerability to owls and quick dogs is related to the property of being a finch, but the reality is we're all at risk while reading Horace.

name: pantomime_horse
text:
My Windows paper clip assistant never talks like that.

Why doesn't it understand that I just want to chat a while?

name: mattfish
text: You know, it's interesting; this strip reminds me of a long-forgotten memory of a friend of mine, who in a bit of a social drought would spend hours talking to AI chatbots like ALICE.

name: mattfish
text: *cough* Ahem. Sorry. like ALICE .

name: pantomime_horse
text:
Somebody decided he wanted a little more out of ALICE.

Not...not that I would do that.

name: tropicana
text: So, it is possible to bang a website.

name: atticusonline
text: Whatever, no cookies for you.

name: tellumo
text: The Shrovis aced the Turing test.

name: valrus
text: Chubbied for beating me to it. Fucker.

name: daidai
text:
He beat you by 13 hours...

disgraceful. I chubby you in compensation.

name: xiaomimi
text: Its sonnet on the Forth Bridge brought the entire committee to tears.

name: vincentkv
text: Chubby for my favorite filthy assistant

name: zadig
text: The Shrovis even got the extra credit: convincing the examiner that they were, in fact, the computer.

name: jay-are
text: We now have ALICE on the table, and a Turing reference... I'm left stuck, trying to think up a Turing/buggery joke that's not TOO distasteful!

name: spectre
text: Strangely enough, The Pointy-Haired Boss recently FLUNKED the Turing test. Is this a Sign? Is it the End of Times?

name: iidebaser
text: I sat next to that publican on the train from PA to NC once.

name: hbaranov
text: Not likely hombre. That's Al Murray, a Brit comedian with the persona of the Pub Landlord.

name: farqussus
text: To call him a comedian is an exercise in hyperbole.

name: hbaranov
text: True. His jokes mainly seem to comprise of a compendium of racial stereotypes and nationalist vigour

name: andyfaewatford
text:
Yeah, I've never really got him. Is his whole thing supposed to be exposing our inbuilt Xenophobia or something? In which case, he'd presumably be really damn happy if we went to his shows and just didn't laugh at any of his jokes, and then left whilst loudly muttering about him being a racist prick...

(Note to Al Murray fans: I know it's a character, he's not really racist, blah blah Jimmy Carr, his show was co-scripted by Richard Herring, etc. In fact, I know more about him than you do, so screw you.)

name: farqussus
text: He says what no-one's thinking!

name: hbaranov
text: Alas. Too late to be chubbed.

name: farqussus
text: your words make my pants as uncomfortably tight as any chubby.

name: johnnyrocker
text: He is a british Larry the Cable Guy?

name: spectre
text: I thought it was Rush Limbaugh, all Britted-up.

name: tekende
text: That's what I thought too! And now I when I read that dialogue, I hear it in Rush Limbaugh's voice, and I can't make it sound any other way!

name: iidebaser
text:
ha, ha! ah, my friend, some would read your comment and say that you took me far too literally and missed my point. but I say fie! fie on those nattering narrow-minded nit-pickers. go for the glory, man, reach for the stars! I say-- I dare to say-- you didn't take me literally enough !

when I wrote, "that publican," I didn't mean some irritating old man who talked nonstop just like that for 12 straight hours, oh no! I didn't even mean that I sat next to curmudgeonly comedian al murray himself! no, my friend...

are you ready? are you ready for the AWFUL TRUTH?? you think you are, but you are not. for here it is: I literally sat literally right next to that literal tiny, one-armed, black and white torso that you see above, and, horribly animated by some treacherous dark arcanum, the tiny golem literally repeated that exact same paragraph over and over again for, literally , the entire trip from philadelphia to spartanburg!!

aye, it was terrible, and aye, I wept.

but that was long ago and far away. the nightmares have... mostly abated. I tell you though, while some descry in a far off train whistle a melancholy, stirring restlessness, a call to cast off the ties of quotidian drudgery, to take the rails once more, even be it simply on the nostalgia express to childhood city , I hear but one eerie echo: "YOU KNOW WHAT REALLY CLIMBS MY PRICK? FOLKS WHO EAT FISH BUT DON'T WORK. TAKIN' IT OUT OF GOOD PEOPLE'S MOUTHS, THEY ARE!"

name: tekende
text: Wow. Virtual chubby.

name: ixalarx
text: I know you! You're that guy from Penny Arcade!

name: gormster
text: Tycho would have used capitals.

name: iidebaser
text: he's about a million times better at it than I am, too!

name: joestork
text: That was some dank Lovecraft.  But with all the ayes, I thought you might have been channeling Cerebus.

name: rowboat
text: ALLEZ CUISINE!

name: hellofyellin
text: Hey Mike.

name: tekende
text: My goodness. This is a fantastic strip. An all-time classic, I do believe.

name: professorhazard
text:
To me, the best part of it - and nobody seems to have picked up on this - is that we consciously know that Cornelius is matched closest to the delicate little finch in personality, but that apparently he does not.

Think about that for a second - think about how difficult it might be to write a character as not knowing what his own character is. It's engaging material.

name: norrin
text: Dramatic irony, I believe it's called.

name: norrin
text: Oh snapdragons I got lamed for possibly knowing a literary term.

name: i_love_kate
text: They fear your wisdom. They believe that it could bring them to harm some day.

name: odei
text: Maybe Connie is just prejudice against finches.

name: achilleselbow
text: He dismisses as preposterous the idea of having anything in common with an animal, despite the fact that he is a bear.

name: falseprophet
text: Cornelius being a self-hating bear is the saddest thing.

name: hayzeus
text:
Is that landlord supposed to be Al Murray?

If it is, I'm even more impressed with the British kick Chris has been on lately. The Bloke does 'is Research .

name: hatstand_mcq

text: No no NO.

name: professorhazard
text: Man, stop linking to this comic strip. Two times now someone has linked to it and two times I have found it extremely not funny. If that comic had the one-through-five rating system that Achewood gives us, it would barely warrant a two.

text: Also, it's actions are so poorly conveyed.

name: farqussus
text: I hope you are not referring to Indietits. Revoke this man's privileges.

name: achilleselbow
text:
You know what I think of Questionable Content? Well...

...just kidding, I think we got enough of this on the last two strips. Damn you for bringing it up again.

name: maximus
text: An anglophile Tom Robbins - good-heartedly surreal and whimsical

name: harveymersault
text: Dr. Cornelius Bear?

name: maximus
text:
What are the metaphysical implications of a strip where a minor character - an animated, screen-based assistant - is drawn more lifelike than the major character he's helping? More lifelike than even the occasional duotone folks like the publican, Johnny Cash, Keith Moon, etc.

And speaking of Keith, where the heck did he go?

name: maximus
text: Is the phone line in your coffin alive, dead or in a quantum superposition of coexisting alive and dead states?

text:

Why didn't I read further?
Why, oh why, didn't I read further?


Yeah, what gives?

text: You don't know until someone answers it. Or doesn't. You should call that man.

text: It is both alive and dead, having split into parallel universes when the coffin was sealed. But you won't make the split until you call it and find out.

text: I thought it was robert fripp

name: milesdonovan
text: Horace is well and good, but I'd to read a dissertation about how much boning Catullus did. (it is a lot, he was the first).

text: Fuck yeah classical studies!

name: fireking
text:
The publician reminds me of the guy from SimCity that says "YOU CAN'T CUT DOWN ON FUNDING. YOU WILL REGRET THIS."

Except he's a fat British glutton who just happens to work for a small independent biweekly in a suburb of London.

name: trollcollins
text: A publican is a bartender.

name: wfl
text:
In the UK, a Publican is also apparently known as a landlord.

Thanks, Google!

name: hbaranov
text: In other news, a man recently advertised in the daily mail for another person to go drinking with his elderly father. 7 quid an hour, and you are expected to talk about WW2 experiences (Kuala Lumpur) and the physics of making a powerplant work. - What happened to publicans?

name: usversusthem
text: Dammit! Now I'm nostalgic for running power lines through coloured squares. This is awful.

text: I was immediately reminded of the Mayor from Advance Wars: Days of Ruin .

text: He got what was coming to him though

text:
THANKS FOR SAVING OUR LIVES EIGHT TIMES, BRENNER.

NOW FUCK OFF. WE DON'T NEED YOUR KIND OF TROUBLE.

Who the hell is Brenner?

Sorry. Who the [i]fuck/i] is alice.

And I presume Brenner is O'Brian's American name.

text: A.L.I.C.E.

name: professorhazard
text: I dunno, you tell me .

name: professorhazard
text: BOWSER ATTACK

name: voloshg
text: You're the best, Chris Onstad!  You did what you said you would do!  I believe in you, from this day forward until forever!  Thank you for keeping your word and posting on Saturday!

name: quantumcasaba
text:
Not on Eastern Standard time, but given geographical differences, we forgive him.
Soon I will be on the west coast anyway, bugger this side of the country.

name: quantumcasaba
text:
I sound like a turd. I did not mean to sound like a turd.
I shouldn't have said that, I shouldn't have jokingly complained. Not about this.

name: pogo
text: Technically, a woman can't "bugger" anyone.

name: irondave
text: No offense, but you may lack some imagination.

name: pogo
text: Oh, I can imagine all sorts of accessories or apendages being used, but in the strictest sense, isn't buggery a dick up the arse?

name: biff
text:
In the strictest sense, yes.

A dick up the arse.

name: achilleselbow
text:
I think that the GLBT community would find your definition of buggery to be both oppressive and patriarchal in its attempt to circumscribe the experience within restrictive gendered norms, and a perfect example of how such norms are reinforced through allegedly 'neutral' appeals to language.

Or, you know, maybe they wouldn't really care that much.

name: pogo
text: Any port in a storm, eh matey?

name: semiquaver
text: There's a twat joke in here somewhere, and I'm afraid it's on you, m'dear.

name: pogo
text: New thought on buggery, "making ass babies."

name: methadone
text: A comment left by methadone was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by dri-ft, BrokeAccount, iidebaser, Comrade_Tom, pogo)

name: heccibiggs
text: Eh, I don't find it that scathing.

name: i_love_kate
text:
Zing! We're apparently comparable to birds. Also, a clever melange of what would sound like average high- and working-class English dialect to an American!

Yeah, I'm pretty sure this isn't meant as a satire. Funny stuff all the same.

name: numberkillinger
text: you didn't understand the comic or i didn't understand your comment (probably the latter)

name: pogo
text: You evidently don't know the meaning of the word, since "scathing implies indignant attacks delivered with fierce severity ." -- according to Merriam-Webster online.

name: dumase
text: Who would have thought that Mr. Teal would be the BEST OF ALL?

name: miku224
text: I certainly wasn't expecting it.

text:
The comment made me laugh for a good while.

I imagined you sarcastically exclaiming the comment with a insincere look of bewilderment on your face.

Thank you for this the comment, dumase.

name: heccibiggs
text: His oversized iron face?

name: solobuttons
text: chubby for both you and dumase. that's exactly the way I pictured it.

name: ferrets54
text: I can't help but suggest that as a gentleman of aristocratic and Oxford graduate Cornelius would indeed have more in common with Al Murray.

name: bondijames
text: I wonder if Mr Teal, "a decent little fellow", will ever meet a certain sardine named Cunty, the damnedest little fellow -- the crossover potential is huge!

name: hamscout
text:
[IMGS OFF]

Once I finished this, I realized the gag only works in a world where Mr Teal is a live, web-chat assistant. I am now the most damnedest little fellow...

name: woodenteeth
text: That's just... great. V-Chub. Trust me, these things are gaining value after the influx of Snickspams.

name: achilleselbow
text: I'm still trying to figure out panel 7. Exactly what meaning of the word "publican" did Cornelius assume applies to him?  Cornelius may be old-school, but I very much doubt he was a tax collector in a Roman province. And while the dumb fellow who appears most closely resembles a Republican of the American variety, he's still obviously British, so what gives?

name: cremlae
text: From Wikipedia , "By the time of the Renaissance, the word 'publican' meant a tavernkeeper." I do believe the Cornelius fits the bill.

name: cremlae
text: *that. Why is it that whenever I get the guts to creep out of silence for one second, I stop learning how to use the English language and become a bumbling buffoon? All, "the me is happy in talk here!", all Little Nephew even looking at me in disdain...

name: quaga
text: Actually, I like the use of a definite article. It implies that ol' Conny has a singular importance not shared by others with the name. He's not just any Cornelius, he's THE Cornelius.

name: riazm
text:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/arts/graphics/2007/03/03/btpub103.jpg

Al Murray.

name: achilleselbow
text: Alright, I guess I was wrong on both counts.

name: achilleselbow
text: I totally forgot about Cornelius' tavern. Chubby for resolving my quandary.

name: alreadyinuse
text:
merriam webster has the tax collector definition, then it has this: 2, chiefly British : the licensee of a public house
I'm still not sure what the hell it means. I guess I would need a British English dictionary to know what a public house is.

yeah, um, Cornelius is like, um, demonstrating, perhaps, in this strip here, that it's a fine line between intellectual engagement and, uh, early onset alzheimer's dementia. I love him but damn, reading that strip reminds me of having a conversation with old people... ya know...

name: girdag
text: Public House = Pub. So basically the guy who owns the bar.

name: i_love_kate
text:
A publican is a pub-owner. Hence Al Murray. Well-known espouser of the theory that Germany is just Britain with more rules. And yay for the phrase "to climb one's prick." That made my day.

Decidedly more uncomfortable.

Also, as apparently some people had trouble understanding this strip, the cut-off word that Cornelius is typing at the end is likely "dissertation."

name: hbaranov
text: And France is Britain with less rules...

name: boredom_man
text: ...and dissertation is just a four-letter word.

name: farqussus
text:
Are you being sarcastic?

I feel I might be missing a point you might be trying to make, because you've always appeared to be the kind of large nostrilled animation that would know a publican is a an owner of a public house, which is commonly shortened to pub, or in some colonies, bar.

name: farqussus
text: wow, i should scroll down. I'm the sixth person to correct you.

name: achilleselbow
text: Apparently the definition from antiquity is more relevant to my life, which is pretty sad if you think about it.

name: falseprophet
text: Since a publican is a dude who owns a public house, a republican is a dude who has repossessed your house.

name: dino_grill
text: For some reason I can't imagine the words "what really climbs my prick" spoken in an English accent.

name: quaga
text: Think more Estuary or Cockney and it sounds more plausible.

name: heccibiggs
text: Oh yeah, we say "prick" plenty. I'm not even cockney. Not even a little bit.

name: quaga
text: Well, of course. I was more pointing out that that specific phrase is not the sort of thing one would hear at Eton. Most of the brits I've known have a dirtier mouth than me, and that's no easy feat.

name: i_love_kate
text: Riprickulous.

name: farqussus
text: Eton lads have the cuntiest mouths of all.

name: usversusthem
text: For some reason, I read the publican's rudeness in the voice of that orc in The Two Towers who's all, "What about them? They're fresh!"

name: achilleselbow
text: That's because all British people either sound like that or like Gandalf. Anyone who tells you different is a liar, and possibly an orc.

name: comrade_tom
text:
sample dialogue frequently heard in middle earth/east london:
"Shut it you Hobbit slag! Or i'll cut you from yer kyber to yer chevy chase!"

name: earendil
text:
As an American I freaking hate rhyming slang! Snatch would have been SO much funnier if I had the SLIGHTEST idea what they were SAYING!

It was a pretty good movie anyway tho.

name: farqussus
text: There, there. I hear Rob Schneider's still making films.

name: autrepoupee
text: Not finding Snatch funny does not equal thinking Rob Schneider is funny.  I thought both of those movies were pretty much not that great.

name: professorhazard
text: There, there. I hear they still make books.

name: comrade_tom
text:
You can buy a cockney ryming slang dictionary, its an invaluable tool.

http://www.amazon.com/Rhyming-Cockney-Slang-Jack-Jones/dp/0902920049/ref=pd_bbs_sr_2?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1207571238&sr=8-2

Its helped me out of a few tight spots. the first person to develope an audio based course will be a genius, i'd love to hear someone yelling along to it on the bus " Repeat after me: APPLES AND PEARS- STAIRS"

name: hbaranov
text: I was recently addressed with "Hail you snivelly maggot. 'ow about you get your arse over ear, and we don't rip your ears off and jelly yer eels."

name: farqussus
text: Right. Which episode of 'Whose Line Is It Anyway?' were you on?

name: eatmorekix
text: chubsssssssss

name: jay-are
text: I always figured that orc in TTT was a Kiwi extra...

name: pr0ncess
text: A comment left by pr0ncess was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by yearsinhotclaws, farqussus, I_Love_Kate)

name: i_love_kate
text: Refer to any number of other comments here to find out what "publican" means. Protip: It's not an upper class ponce.

name: pr0ncess
text: Um, darling, I know full well what a publican is. I was making a point about how amused I am by the juxtaposition of a patronising upper-class ponce who FANCIES himself a publican (his "pub" is in the California, which is a great start)... and the image of a real pub owner...

name: professorhazard
text: The difference is that a real pub owner will casually break one of your bones over a small dispute, right?

name: numberkillinger
text: Take back those things you said about Cornelius, or i'll hit you with professorhazard's chair!

name: tekende
text: But...but then were will professorhazard sit?

name: professorhazard
text: Oh, I sit enough, really. I could use a stroll.

name: i_love_kate
text: Pfft. I have admittedly mistaken the point of your post (I need to stop putting myself in a situation where I have to say that.) but Cornelius is as much "the real deal" as any stereotype working-class thug. In fact, of the publicans I know, their characters are more akin to the affable, worldly Cornelius than the xenophobic Murray.

name: rogergs
text: In the matter of subroutines for nattering, wittering and generally rabbiting-on, Shrovis-Bishopthorpe is altogether the envy of Redmond.

name: girdag
text:
For all those confused about the Publican, it's almost certainly a reference to Al Murray

*Prays the BBCode works*

name: heccibiggs
text: I wonder if this means that Onstad hates Al Murray as much as I do.

name: brokeaccount
text: As he's a man of high mind I think it's almost certain. After all he has basically summed up Al Murray's entire r'epertoire in three boorish, fragmented sentences.

name: numberkillinger
text:
Cornelius' burn on Al Murray is simple yet devastatingly accurate. I hate Al Murray so much; almost as much as i hate alan carr.
also, i wondered why the boffin's mattress was stuffed with chopped pork . (for about 11 seconds)

name: daidai
text:
That video in the previous post was my first and hopefully last encounter with Al Murray.

I didn't know people could be that annoying.

name: odei
text: There are a lot of incredibly shit comedians that are incredibly popular over here, but then that's standard fare everywhere I guess. At least we don't have to put up with Carlos Mencia or Dane Cook.

name: eatmorekix
text:
apparently carlos mencia is known within the comic circuit as "carlos men-steal-a" for his habit of appropriating others' material. (why the comic circuit couldn't think of a move clever moniker escapes me.)

as for dane cook, roger ebert said this of him in the movie Good Luck Chuck:

"There is a scene in this movie where a penguin bites Dane Cook in the crotch. I'd like to find that penguin and buy it a drink."

name: farqussus
text: Carlos Mencia was the subject of much of Joe Rogan's ire, for that very reason, during one of Carlos' live shows. It is very funny to behold.

name: achilleselbow
text:
[IMGS OFF]

Dear lord spare me from that awful Dane Cook.

name: comrade_tom
text: Is Dane cook a confusing motivational speaker, or just a shit comedian?

name: professorhazard
text:
He's one of those guys who thinks that reminiscing about the '80s and talking about his penis makes for good stand-up comedy.

And I agree with him, which puts me in a very self-conscious and guilt-inducing minority in most social situations.

name: tekende
text: I too find him pretty amusing. I wouldn't claim he's a truly great comedian, but I have been known to laugh at a significant number of his jokes. Not that I own any of his DVDs or anything.

name: achilleselbow
text: But tekende, Dane Cook is silly! It is silly to like Dane Cook! He is a silly person!

name: chachibenji
text:
That is actually his angle.
His worth is judgable by the people who quote him.
Majority being frat boys on campus who quote horrible lines from horrible things.
He is just such a horrible comedian.
Good in movies though.

name: farqussus
text:
Unfortunately, the same people are inclined to yell 'Charlie Murphy!', but Dave Chappelle is a much better comedian.

I guess the fact that that kind of attention sent Dave to South Africa and away from ten million dollars illustrates their difference.

name: brokeaccount
text:
WAIT JUST A DAMN SECOND. THAT'S NO FINCH!

...

Alright, yes it is.

name: comrade_tom
text: I wish the people who go to Al murray gigs would realise he's being ironic and playing a character, 80% of them think he is a real pub landlord, not an oxford allumni who's grandfather was a kinght of the realm.

name: brokeaccount
text: When the act is so one-dimensional who could blame them.

name: margargaret
text:
Wow. So he's like the British equivalent of "Larry the Cable Guy".

Except that 100% of the people who like him think he is one of them, because only idiots think he is funny.

name: comrade_tom
text:
Thats a rather perceptive analogy, i suppose its something like that. I've not seen much Larry the cable guy, but what i have seen i didnt enjoy.

Still bread and circuses i suppose, idiots have to be entertained, mr Murray and Mr "the cable guy" are fufilling a necessary service. Their deplorable fans have to be entertained and fed otherwise they burn down the forum, give senators wedgies, make crude remarks about pliny's dress sense etc etc....

name: maximus
text: deplorable?

name: falseprophet
text: Larry The Cable Guy used to have a soul . Sadly, he's never been funny.

name: daidai
text:
You didn't need to say "except".

Both of them aren't as annoying and dumb as they act -- despite what their fans think.

name: margargaret
text: They're probably actually are just as annoying.

name: comrade_tom
text:
Al Murray is a genuinely clever man, considering he got a degree from the best university in the country, also in the documentary he did on ww2 he interviewed german veterans as well which was a refreshing change (he also speaks french and german). His character is irratating, but then characters can have no bearing on the real person (Nicholas cage IS NOT a heroic firefighter who braved 911 for example).

As for Mr "The Cable guy" he may play a gamma sub-moron, but he must have a lot of guile to have made that much money simply by yelling redneck catchphrases, thousands of people ihn america do that every day, but he's managed to make a comfortable living out of it.

thats not to say i support either of them, after all Michael Bay makes a lot of money but that doesnt make what he does acceptable.

name: professorhazard
text: You can imagine the end of the day - when Larry goes home and looks in the mirror, his face sallow, seeing nothing but a hollow shell. A mask, with no man behind it.

name: tekende
text:
He whispers to his reflection in a hoarse voice, cracking around the edges:

"Git 'r done."

name: professorhazard
text:
He eyes the handgun on his dresser, thinking the same words he has thought every night for the past five years: I don't think I can do this much longer.

Then collapsing, sobbing in the corner, empty bottle of Jack Daniels, etc.

name: irondave
text: I think that in fact Larry has already been through the "empty bottle of Jack" phase of his career.  He may fade away, but I bet he dies a rich and happy man.

name: yearsinhotclaws
text:
[img=http://img148.imageshack.us/img148/7642/lylethecableguyxm7.th.gif]

I guess this might be pretty obvious at this point but I think I'll make the joke anyway to see if the code works.

name: missionofburma
text:
Fuuuck

[IMGS OFF]

name: missionofburma
text: TODAY WE WATCH DAVID FUCK UP POSTING IMAGES

name: numberkillinger
text: ok, i'll concede that Al Murray is probably a smart bastard, but "Al Murray" is a stupid man and i hate his comedy.

name: farqussus
text: I was thinking just the same thing. Add to the list any one else who thinks volume is a substitute for wit, and catch phrases are clever. Andrew Dice Clay for example.

name: redmange
text: Other Publicans giving me a bad name really climbs my prick.

name: bixschmix
text: Cornelius is just so happy to have someone to talk to about his dissertation. I know how he feels...

name: rabbidpanda
text: Cornelius' dissertation was on the effects of classic literature on local food chains.

name: nymphadoria
text: Cornelius' computer goes blank just as he is preparing to ask Mr.Teal if he enjoys the works of Plato, he is devastated.

name: ragtagop
text: I think perhaps that, what with references to Al Murray and the hosts and guests of Top Gear, that Onstad is definitely enjoying BBC America when not tending to his deplorable cultus.

name: ddgoec
text:
LOVE CULTUS

LOVE THEM

name: irondave
text: People who might want to be part of an Achewood-oriented meetup that might happen in the south-central or southwestern US are invited to visit gin_ocean and ask to join the group.

name: darleen
text: I say, I am quite rather enjoying this fine story arc. Pip pip.

name: daidai
text: Cheerio

name: ishuta
text: But wait, a crumpet?

name: achilleselbow
text: Consider the crumpet.

name: tekende
text: You consider the crumpet. It is honest cooked, with a firm filling.

name: sncether
text:
: take crumpet
The crumpet is on the far side of the counter.
: climb counter
A publican eyes you, wiping meaty hands on his filthy apron. You decide against this course.
: talk publican
"Fancy a drink, my son?"
: yes please
The publican fixes you a delicious concoction of coconut-infused rum and tropical juices.
: holy smokes

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
hours and hours later...


: introduce publican
"Dad this is Randy"

name: tekende
text: Virtual chubbyyyyy

name: flazisismuss
text:
Thanks to the links, I now hate Al Murray as well. Much obliged, Acheworld community!

Am I the only one wondering what Cornelius' dissertation is on? It could be anything, but I'm guessing "Home viniculture of the Cornelii Scipiones during the first and second centuries B.C."

name: rabbidpanda
text: I think it is safe to assume that is is something related to something that came up in the last panel.  I doubt much that Cornelius, though very proud of his dissertation, would not feel compelled to tell Mr. Teal of his unrelated research.

name: mikeleffel2
text: Bless you, Onstad!

name: loneal
text: All right, I'm getting on a plane to England in a few hours. England better be exactly the way Onstad portrays it. If the teals don't read Latin, I'm going to be so disappointed.

name: cousinted
text: Am I the only one who thinks a publican and a boffin both sound like sea-birds?

name: baryonyx
text: Depends. When you say "sea birds", does that include pelicans? Puffins?

name: biff
text: A Puffin is just a combination of a Publican and a Boffin.

name: chachibenji
text:
Large mouth, affinity to cramming fish into it, silly appearance.
Oh he is most right on this one.

name: molesticide
text:
hey wow! i just saw achewood in PRINT in this week's issue of the willamette week! fuckin' GO oregon.

although i realize that, what with that having been released on thursday, this being a sunday, and the unnecessary proliferation of assetbar commentary, this topic has surely already been discussed to a wonderful death.

and it's probably in print elsewhere too. but go to hell, i'm excited.

name: farqussus
text: first I've heard of it. I find this to be interesting.

name: nice-on-water
text: The day any local paper of mine (this means both hometown and college town) publishes Achewood is the day I [insert improbable action here].

name: molesticide
text:
oh, well, it wasn't like a regular THING or anything, it's more like the dudes are trying to replace some shitty other comic that doesn't exist anymore and that, not being achewood, i didn't bother to remember the name of. achewood was this week's trial strip.

hey! here's a fun idea! everybody who reads this post go to (I got the name of the publication wrong the first time) the Portland Mercury website and vote for achewood! help me get achewood in my local weekly press!

i do not know the address for said website, because i am a dick

name: tropicana
text: The website is portlandmercury.com , but their layout sucks and I couldn't find anywhere to vote for Achewood in less time than it takes me to drink a cup of disgusting vending machine coffee.

name: royalewihcheese
text:
WELCOME to Shrovis-Bishopthorpe.

You can do ANYTHING at Shrovis-Bishopthorpe.

The only limit is your imagination.

Welcome.

name: maximus
text:
screen saver:
[IMGS OFF]
"Honi soit qui mal y numerote"

name: daidai
text: All with some very loud, operatic tenor belting "God Save The Queen" ad nauseum

name: darleen
text: Holy crap! I just realised that publican is good ol' Bullethead from Time Gentlemen Please. I love you even more Achewood! Bloody French! NEVER CONFUSED!!!

name: baryonyx
text: He reminds me of a British stand-up comedian I saw on YouTube once who kept bashing this one member of the audience while drinking several gallons of Guinness directly from the barrel.

name: tropicana
text: The total lack of hilarity in Al Murray's routine aside, that sounds like the best job to have, ever.

name: qingofchina
text: You know caffeine is bad for your health Al Murray. It causes delirium. Serious delirium.

name: qingofchina
text: I think it was MR. TEAL in the office with the BIC.

name: lunchbox
text: I do enjoy people ripping on Britain after what the country did to me. My time staying in London, Glasgow, and Cookstown only got me three things: alcohol when I was 19, an autographed picture of John Cleese, and me being the only person in the theater to laugh when I saw Two Towers when Gimli said "Toss me" when I returned stateside.

name: numberkillinger
text: two of those things are pretty damn good!

name: sncether
text: So when you call tech support for your Shrovis-Bishopthorpe, does it connect you to Mumbai or Bombay?

name: thorfinn
text: Kolkata

name: professorhazard
text: Hyderabad.

name: chachibenji
text: Micronesia.

name: farqussus
text: Slough.

name: boredom_man
text: The Principality of Sealand.

name: pursesnatcher
text: once again, a reading of achewood ends me up on the wikipedia.

name: smallblackdog
text:
Sir,

Damnnit.

Yr servant.

name: coolbreeze3
text: That's Dr. Cornelius Bear to you my lad.

name: kelissamunz
text: I honestly read that as "the boffin is sleeping on a narrow mattress filled with chopped pork." But yes, chopped CORK makes a slightly greater amount of sense.

name: evolume
text: Tuppence, Tuppence, Tuppence a bag.

name: maximus
text: You're gonna make me get all misty

name: maximus
text:
I guess that spinynorman has:
1. been away
2. correctly surmises that this strip speaks for itself and any commentary is superfluous
3. Has decided debating the merits of Anglophilia has been exhausted

In any case, 'You're a better man than I am, Gunga Din'

name: doc_rostov
text:
And... why do you follow spinynorman so preci--oh. Ohhhh. Oh, goodness gracious!

Maximus, do you have a crush on spinynorman?

name: doc_rostov
text:
ps: hey man it's okay if you do do not feel bad about it due to such as a fact as that after all maximus only one of us hates people of Alternative Lifestyles here and that's soticoto

(and soticoto is silly!)

(it is silly to listen to soticoto!)

name: maximus
text: No - I just felt like I was vanity posting without really having anything interesting to say and that this strip really needed no commentary. Then I noticed that spinynorman was silent and thought perhaps he felt the same way but had the presence of mind not to post when the circumstances did not warrant it. There are probably many others, but I read Achewood through twice before I found this community and don't really know my way around.

name: tekende
text: spinynorman's wife is in a coma.

name: maximus
text: I really hope you're kidding

name: farqussus
text: I don't tend to find any strip needing commentary. I just make snobbish and/or smartarse comments on other people's comments. I have no thoughts of my own but that other people's thoughts are poorly conveyed.

name: tekende
text: I'm pretty sure spinynorman doesn't have a wife, so, yes, I'm kidding.

name: atticusonline
text:
1. Lists are awesome
2. Lists about spinynorman are awesome
3.

name: falseprophet
text: Cornelius's face shows so much emotion in the first three panels.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: his emotions are so well conveyed.

name: nice-on-water
text: I just noticed how in the first two panels only Cornelius' eyebrows show over the top of the laptop.  I like it, I like it.

name: freerhi
text: yes,jumps.

name: nicejames
text: I wish that I was so high an intellect as Cornelius, that upon hearing an informed opinion or frighteningly little-known fact I could open my next sentence by saying, "Why, my dissertation revolved around the matter of your mention!"  But I am still young.

name: twells
text: the publican looks like Al Murray
